definition: traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: Let the traffic policemen wear black cotton gloves.
He defended himself, saying the cops just happened to be in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 他爲自己進行辯護，說交警們只是碰巧在那裏。

sentences.english: Those eligible for this scheme will be notified by the Traffic Police.
sentences.chinese: 那些符合這個方案將獲專函通知交警。

sentences.english: The car with a flat tire is being handled by traffic police.
sentences.chinese: 交警正在處理那輛車胎沒氣的汽車。

sentences.english: The court extended the defendant's time for serving his defense by fourteen days.
sentences.chinese: 法院把被告送交警答辯狀的時間延長了14天。

sentences.english: Traffic police have been trying to fill that void.
sentences.chinese: 交警試圖填補這一空白。

sentences.english: Traffic police and highway patrolmen patrol all roads to see if the traffic is in order.
sentences.chinese: 交警和公路巡警在路上巡邏維持秩序。

sentences.english: Make the police nine brother has a habit, just in the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 交警九哥有個習慣，只在馬路中央疾走。

sentences.english: When the traffic accident happens, please call 122.
sentences.chinese: 發生交通事故，可撥交警大隊電話122。

sentences.english: A few women already serve in the traffic police.
sentences.chinese: 目前，已有少數女性開始在交警支隊工作。

definition: civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
